title: Latest News from Science Magazine
description: Keyword search result for Alerts: News Weekly Headlines -- New results matching your keyword search query (updated daily).

items.title: Falling space junk can be tracked from its sonic booms
items.description: Seismic stations can accurately map re-entering debris with high accuracy

items.title: Hulking kangaroo ancestors could hop just like their nimble descendants
items.description: Fossils reveal these ancient footbones were robust enough to withstand the impacts of leaping locomotion

items.title: How Trump's moves could dramatically reshape the scientific workforce
items.description: Threats to funding and cuts to diversity efforts are putting pressure on the pipeline of new scientists

items.title: Ice age Europeans imported tools from distant lands, perhaps as souvenirs
items.description: Mementos may have reinforced vast social networks during turbulent times

items.title: In the age of Trump, are U.S. scientists ‘bringing white papers to a gunfight’?
items.description: An unprecedented assault has forced researchers to rethink their advocacy tactics

items.title: Bizarre 400-million-year-old fossil was an unknown life form
items.description: Enigmatic organism known as Prototaxites cannot be fungus, new analysis finds

items.title: Magnetically sensitive proteins could lead to new imaging tools and remote-controlled drugs
items.description: New study shows how engineered proteins can be tracked with an MRI-like approach

items.title: These ancient handprints may represent some of the world’s first rock art
items.description: Hand stencils from a Southeast Asian cave predate Neanderthal cave art from Europe

items.title: Trove of Mexican genomes could help guide prescribing decisions
items.description: Study reveals role of “fine-grained” ancestry in predicting response to painkillers, statins, and other drugs

items.title: Spacecraft captures a solar flare as it builds into an explosive outburst
items.description: Europe’s Solar Orbiter is helping researchers understand what causes the Sun to blast out radiation and particles
